verses.roman:
sametya tarasā pratyag
dvābhyāṁ padbhyāṁ balaṁ balī
nihatyorasi kā-śabdaṁ
muñcan paryasarat khalaḥ

synonyms: sametya—meeting Him; tarasā—swiftly; pratyak—hind; dvābhyām—with the two; padbhyām—legs; balam—Lord Baladeva; balī—the powerful demon; nihatya—striking; urasi—upon the chest; kā-śabdam—an ugly braying sound; muñcan—releasing; paryasarat—ran around; khalaḥ—the jackass.
translation: The powerful demon rushed up to Lord Baladeva and sharply struck the Lord's chest with the hooves of his hind legs. Then Dhenuka began to run about, braying loudly.
